# Question

Write a pig latin transformer called `pig_latinify` that operates on a vector of strings. It iterates over each string and changes it to pig latin. Each iteration should run on a separate thread.

```julia
using Threads

function pig_latinify(strings::Vector{String})
    pig_latin_strings = Vector{String}(undef, length(strings))
    
    for i in 1:length(strings)
        @threads pig_latin_strings[i] = pig_latinify_string(strings[i])
    end
    
    return pig_latin_strings
end

function pig_latinify_string(word::String)
    vowels = Set(['a', 'e', 'i', 'o', 'u'])
    first_vowel_index = findfirst(x -> x in vowels, lowercase(word))
    
    if first_vowel_index == nothing
        return word * "ay"
    elseif first_vowel_index == 1
        return word * "way"
    else
        return word[first_vowel_index:end] * word[1:first_vowel_index-1] * "ay"
    end
end
```

Note that the `@threads` macro is used to parallelize the transformations on multiple threads. Make sure to update your Julia version to the latest stable release that includes support for parallel execution.

```julia
julia> strings = ["hello", "world", "julia", "programming"]
4-element Vector{String}:
 "hello"
 "world"
 "julia"
 "programming"

julia> pig_latinify(strings)
4-element Vector{String}:
 "ellohay"
 "orldway"
 "uliaway"
 "ogrammingpray"
```
